title: Update to latest Gameday Bundle_MIAN-665
custom_preconds:
We need to update the MiLB Gameday webview to use the latest Android Gameday bundle.

Per Russell Munson:

The latest bundle is version 1.0.0-beta.1 although this will be updating prior to official launch.

- Beta Bundle: https://beta-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html
- QA Bundle: https://qa-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html
- Prod Bundle: https://prod-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html
- Example with a gamepk: https://beta-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html#game_state=final,game_tab=box,game=509803

Important changes to note about hash params:

- game: uses game_pk, rather than gameid since we've switched to the api
- game_state: the state values have been adjusted from "Pregame", "PitchByPitch", "Wrapup" to "preview, live, final"

All builds will be deployed to s3, and accessible at the path:
https://{env}-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html

Where:
env = dev|qa|beta|prod
version = build version string

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the Beta bundle
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Beta endpoint is:
https://{env}-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html

i.e. https://beta-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the QA bundle
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the QA endpoint is:
https://{env}-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html

i.e. https://qa-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user accesses the PROD bundle
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Prod endpoint is:
https://{env}-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html

i.e. https://prod-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user access a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the game endpoint uses game_pk, rather than gameid since we've switched to the api:

https://{env}-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html#game_state=xxx,game_tab=xxx,game=xxxxxx

i.e.
https://beta-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/1.0.0-beta.1/bundle/index.html#game_state=final,game_tab=box,game=509803

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user access the game
AND views the game_state=xxx
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the values have been adjusted from:
- Pregame to game_state=Preview
- PitchByPitch to game_state=Live
- Wrapup to game_state=Final

title: Config Extras File for Gameday
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the app
And is using Charles Proxy
custom_steps:
When the user views the config extras files for gameday

- milbextras.xml file (Prod version below)
http://appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml

- milbservermessages.json file (Prod version below)
http://appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json
custom_expected: Then the files should point to the following directories

custom_steps_separated.content: QA
custom_steps_separated.expected:
http://qa-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml

http://qa-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json


*where x.x.x is the app version number

custom_steps_separated.content: Prod
custom_steps_separated.expected:
http://appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml

http://appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json

*where x.x.x is the app version number

custom_steps_separated.content: Beta
custom_steps_separated.expected:
http://beta-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml

http://beta-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json

*where x.x.x is the app version number

title: Gameday Bundles inside Config Extras Files
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the app
And is using Charles Proxy
AND the user views the config extras files

PROD
- http://appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml
- http://appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json

QA
- http://qa-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml
- http://qa-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json

BETA
- http://beta-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbextras.xml
- http://beta-appconfig.milb.com/android/x.x.x/milbservermessages.json

where x.x.x=version number
i.e. http://appconfig.milb.com/android/3.3.1/milbextras.xml
custom_steps: When the user views the gameday bundles (inside the config extras file)
custom_expected: Then the bundles files / versions should point to the latest version:

custom_steps_separated.content: QA
custom_steps_separated.expected:
https://qa-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html


i.e. https://qa-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/4.0.0-android-milb.2/bundle/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content: Prod
custom_steps_separated.expected:
https://prod-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html

i.e. https://prod-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/4.0.0-android-milb.2/bundle/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content: Beta
custom_steps_separated.expected:
https://beta-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/{version}/bundle/index.html

i.e. https://beta-gameday.mlbstatic.com/app-android-milb/4.0.0-android-milb.2/bundle/index.html

title: View Gameday version in MiLB First Pitch app
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Gameday
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on the Plays tab
AND taps on the Scoring tab
AND scrolls to the bottom
custom_expected:
THEN the gameday bundle version is visible in the following format: v#.#.#-android-milb.#

i.e. v4.0.0-android-milb.2

title: Preview: Clicking on a game in a Preview State will display Game Preview
custom_preconds:
Given the user is using the Full app
And is on the scoreboard
And there is a game in a Preview State available
custom_steps: When the user clicks on a game in a Preview State
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Pregame in Gameday

title: Preview: Game in a Preview State displays Preview information correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to Scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of Preview available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in a state of preview
And we select the Gameday icon
custom_expected: Then the Pregame tab will load with the following correct info

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Team Logos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team's logos are accurate

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Team records
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Team's record (W-L) is below the team logo and has the following format 

i.e. (20-15)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views Game Time
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Game Time has the following format: HH:MM am/pm time zone

i.e. 10:35 am EDT

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Date has the following format: MM DD, YYYY

i.e. May 17, 2018

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Stadium
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Stadium name appears correctly

i.e. PNC Field

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Location
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the City, State has the following format

i.e. Moosic, PA

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the MiLB.TV and Radio feed (if available)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MiLB.tv feed has the following format:
TeamName TV: Feed - Radio: Feed

i.e. IronPigs TV: MiLB.TV - Radio: TuneIn Audio

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Pitchers
and pitchers are avaiable
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Pitcher info has the following format:
PitcherName, Throws (RHP or LHP), #, W-L, ERA, K

i.e. 
Enyel De Los Santos, RHP, #21
4-0
0.84 ERA 39 K

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Pitchers
and pitchers are not available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Pitcher info will display TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Lineup
and Lineup is available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Lineup will appear with the following stats:

AVG, AB, HR, RBI

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Lineup
and Lineup is Not available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then currently appears blank space??

title: Warmup: Game in a state of Warmup has white text
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of Warmup available
custom_steps:
When we tap the game in the state of warmup
And we select the gameday icon
custom_expected:
Then the pitch by pitch view will load 
And we will see warmup in white text at the top of the tab

title: Warmup: Game in a state of Warmup has all tabs selectable and no game data is populated
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to Scoreboard
And we have a game in a state of Warmup available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in a state of Warmup
And we select the gameday icon
custom_expected:
Then we are able to select the Game tab
And we are able to select the Box tab
And we are able to select the Plays tab
And we are able to select the Field tab
And no game data has been populated

title: Live: Game in the state of Live will be brought to the Live tab
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in the state of live
OR tap the Gameday icon from the scoreboard quick action menu
custom_expected:
Then Gameday will open to the Live tab
And there will be a black banner along the top with the AWAY/HOME team codes, Inning, Count, # of Outs and a base pad

title: Live: Strike is thrown and the pitch appears as Red
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game that is in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in a state of live
And we select the gameday tab
And there is a strike thrown
custom_expected: Then we will see that the ball appears as red

title: Live: Ball is thrown and the pitch appears as Green
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And we have a game that is in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in a state of live 
And we select the gameday tab 
And there is a ball thrown
custom_expected: Then we will see that the ball appears as green

title: Live: Ball is in play and the pitch appears as Blue
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And we have a game that is in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in a state of live 
And we select the gameday tab 
And there is a ball in play
custom_expected: Then we will see that the ball appears as blue

title: Live: No pitch by pitch available in a live game
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of live available
And this particular game has it's pitch by pitch turned off (Request this type of game from Schedules)
custom_steps:
When we select the live game in question
And we tap on the gameday tab
And we tap on the game tab
custom_expected:
Then we will see a webview instead of the normal gameday
And the webview will state "No pitch data available for this game"

title: Live: Live Tab involving Player Names
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of live
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in the state of live
And we select the gameday tab
custom_expected:
Then the formatting under the Live Tab will be correct
And the various text under the Live Tab will be readable

title: Live: Pitching counts appear correctly in the various Gameday tabs and on the Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game currently in the state of live
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in a state of live
And we select the gameday tab
custom_expected: Then we can see that the pitch counts update correctly on the various tabs

title: Live: Single, Double, Triple and a Home Run appear correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a live game available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the live game
and we select the gameday tab
and we string a Single
and we string a Double
and we string a Triple
and we string a Home Run
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the Single appears correctly
And we will see that a Double appears correctly
And we will see that a Triple appears correctly
And we will see that a Home Run appears correctly

title: Live: Inning indicator on the various tabs in gameday updates correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap the game that has a state of live
And we select the gameday icon
And we navigate through the various tabs
custom_expected: Then we will see that the inning for the game in question is correct on each tab

title: Live: Tab refreshes correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And there is a live game currently available
custom_steps:
When we tap on that particular live game
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the LiveTab
custom_expected: Then the Game tab should refresh correctly as the game updates

title: Live: Batters that bat right handed appear on the left side of the plate
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a live game currently available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the live game
And we select the Gameday tab
And we select the Live Tab
And there is currently a right handed batter up
custom_expected: Then we will see that the the batter appears on the correct side of the plate, which would be the left in this case as it's from the pitchers perspective.

title: Live: Batters that bat left handed appear on the right side of the plate
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And we have a live game currently available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the live game 
And we select the Gameday tab 
And we select the Game Tab 
And there is currently a left handed batter up
custom_expected: Then we will see that the the batter appears on the correct side of the plate, which would be the right in this case as it's from the pitchers perspective.

title: Live: Switch hitters assume the opposite side of the plate from what the pitcher throws
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a live game available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the live game
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Game Tab
And we have a Switch Hitter up
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the switch hitter is on the right side of the plate for right handed pitchers
And we will see that the switch hitter is on the left side of the plate for left handed pitchers

title: Live: Pitches that have occurred for that particular play display properly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in the state of live
And we tap the Gameday Tab
And we tap the Game Tab
And we tap on a Play
custom_expected:
Then the Play will expand
And the Play will properly display all the pitches that have occurred against it

title: Live: Pitcher is formatted in the following way: <pitchers name> ERA, <pitches thrown> (<strikes> S, <balls> B)
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in question
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Live Tab
custom_expected: Then we will see that next to the pitcher area that it's formatted like the following: <pitchers name> ERA, <pitches thrown> (<strikes> S, <balls> B)

title: Box: Box Tab is selectable and appears correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
Or we have a game in the state of final available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in the state of live
Or we tap on the game in the state of final
And we tap on the Gameday Tab
And we tap on the Box Tab
custom_expected:
Then the Box Tab is selectable
And the Box Tab appears correctly

title: Box: Tab refreshes correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And there is a live game currently available
custom_steps:
When we tap on that particular live game 
And we select the Gameday Tab 
And we select the Box Tab
custom_expected: Then the Box Tab should refresh as the game updates

title: Box: Format and readability of the Box Tab involving Player Names
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And there is a game in the state of live
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in the state of live 
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Box Tab
custom_expected:
Then the formatting under the Box Tab will be correct 
And the various text under the Box Tab will be readable

title: Box: Home Team is displayed second after the Away Team
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of live available
Or there is a game in the state of final available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in question
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Box Tab
custom_expected:
Then we will see that the Home Team is listed after the Away Team in the Line Score
And we will see that the Home Team is listed after the Away Team for the player information as well

title: Box: Switch between Home and Away Teams
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in the state of live
And taps on the Gameday Tab
And taps on the Box Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Away Team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Away Team will appear and will display it's correct lineup

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Home Team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Home Team Will appear and will display it's correct lineup

title: Box: Game is in extra innings
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game with extra innings available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game with extra innings
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Box Tab
custom_expected: Then we are able to navigate to see all of the extra innings

title: Box: Open up Player Cards
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in question
And select the Gameday Tab
And select the Box Tab
And tap on a Player's Name
custom_expected: Then that Player's respective Player Card opens

title: Box: Batters statistics available
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Box Tab
custom_expected:
Then we can see that the batters have the following statistics available: AB, R, H, RBI, BB, SO & AVG 

(LOB to be added future versions?)

title: Box: Pitchers statistics available
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And there is a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question 
And selects the Gameday Tab 
And selects the Box Tab
custom_expected: Then we can see that the pitchers have the following statistics available: IP, H, R, ER, BB, SO, HR & ERA

title: Box: Line Score
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Box Tab
custom_expected: Then we can see in the Line Score that R, H & E are appropriately displayed at the end

title: Plays: Plays Tab is selectable and appears correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And we have a game in the state of live available
Or we have a game in the state of final available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in the state of live 
Or we tap on the game in the state of final 
And we tap on the Gameday Tab 
And we tap on the Plays Tab
custom_expected:
Then the Plays is selectable 
And the Plays Tab appears correctly

title: Plays: Tab should refresh correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And there is a live game currently available
custom_steps:
When we tap on that particular live game 
And we select the Gameday Tab 
And we select the Plays Tab
custom_expected: Then the Plays Tab should refresh as the game updates

title: Plays: Plays update correctly for that particular game
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
AND we have a game currently in the state of live

XML Example:
QA
http://gd.qa.mlb.com/components/game/aaa/year_2016/month_03/day_28/gid_2016_03_28_tolaaa_louaaa_1/game_events.xml

PROD
http://wapc.mlb.com/gdcross/components/game/afa/year_2016/month_05/day_31/gid_2016_05_31_tbyafa_clrafa_1/game_events.xml
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in question
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Plays Tab
And we watch for a few plays
And we check the game_events.xml
custom_expected: Then the Plays being displayed will contain everything in the games_events.xml for that particular game

title: Plays: Toggle through the various innings
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard tab
And we have a game currently in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
And selects the All Plays Tab
And tap on the various innings
custom_expected: Then the correct inning will successfully load up

title: Plays: Extra Innings are accurately portrayed under plays and can be selected
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game available that has gone to extra innings
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
custom_expected:
Then we can accurately see the Extra Innings being displayed
And we can successfully click on the Extra Innings

title: Plays: Click on the Scoring hyperlink and the Scores portion appears
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game currently in the state of live available
And the game in question has runs scored against it
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
And taps on the Scoring hyperlink
custom_expected: Then the Scoring information will correctly appear

title: Plays: Click on the All Plays hyperlink and the Plays portion appears
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard 
And we have a game currently in the state of live available 
And the game in question has runs scored against it
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
 And selects the Gameday Tab 
And selects the Plays Tab 
And taps on the All Plays hyperlink
custom_expected: Then the All Plays information will correctly appear

title: Plays: Scoring changes are in bold text within blue label
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game currently in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
custom_expected: Then all scoring changes will appear in Bold Text within a blue scoring label

title: Plays: Non-plays will display with a light gray background
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
And taps on All Plays tab

And we string a Pitcher Change
And we string a Defensive Substitution
And we string an On Field Delay
And we string an Offensive Change
custom_expected: Then each of the non-plays will appear with a light gray background

title: Plays: Normal plays will be bolded with a white background
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game currently still in the state of live available
And the game in question has at least 1 play completed in it
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
custom_expected: Then the normal plays will have a white background

title: Plays: Pitch count appears
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game currently in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
custom_expected:
Then a pitch count will appear under each play
And the pitch count text will be smaller
And the pitch count will be in the format of "Ball: x Strike: y Out: z"

title: Plays: Change between the Top and the Bottom of the inning
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game currently in the state of live available
custom_steps:
When the user clicks on the game in question
And selects the Gameday Tab
And selects the Plays Tab
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the "Top of the x inning" displayed properly with the Away team's logo

title: Box Score: Game in Final has the appropriate information
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And we have a game in the state of final available
custom_steps:
When we tap on the game in question
And we select the Gameday Tab
And tap on the Box Score tab
custom_expected:
Then we will see the Team Logos being displayed:

- Winning Team will be on the left
- Winning Team's record will be under it's logo

- Losing Team will be on the right
- Losing Team's record will be under it's logo

- Line Score will be available

- Winning Pitcher will be under the Line Score
- Winning Pitcher will have their name (record, era) after it

- Losing Pitcher will be to the right of the the Winning Pitcher
- Losing Pitcher will have their name (record, era) after it

- Home Runs will be under the Losing Pitcher if there are any
- Away Team Will show up first under Home Runs if there are any
- Home Team will show up under the Away Team if they have Home Runs otherwise they will show up under the Home Runs

title: Box Score: Home Team is displayed second after the Away Team
custom_preconds:
Given we have navigated to the Scoreboard
And there is a game in the state of final available
custom_steps:

And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Box Score Tab
custom_expected:

And we will see that the Home Team is listed after the Away Team for the player information as well

custom_steps:

And taps on the Gameday Tab
And taps on the Box Score Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Away Team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Away Team will appear and will display it's correct lineup

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Home Team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Home Team Will appear and will display it's correct lineup

title: Plays: Game in Final has the appropriate information
custom_preconds:

custom_steps:

custom_expected:

And the Winning Team will be on the left

And the Losing Pitcher will have their name (record, era) after it
And the Home Runs will be under the Losing Pitcher if there are any
And the Away Team Will show up first under Home Runs if there are any
And the Home Team will show up under the Away Team if they have Home Runs otherwise they will show up under the Home Runs

title: Video: Verify that if we start a video that any and all audio that was previously running pauses

Or we currently have a game in the state of final available
And there is at least 1 Video available for that particular game
custom_steps:
When we click on the game in question
And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Videos Tab
And we tap on a Video
custom_expected:
Then the other applications Audio will pause
And the Video will begin to play
And we will be able to hear the audio for the Video playing if it has any

And we select the Gameday Tab
And we select the Videos Tab
And we select a Video
custom_expected:

And the Video will begin
And the Video's Audio will begin to play if it's available

title: Video: Verify that if we're watching a Video and we receive an Alarm that the Video pauses briefly for the Alarm notification before continuing

And we have a Video available
custom_steps:

And we tap on the Videos Tab
And we have setup an Alarm to go off during the Video
And we start up the Video in question
custom_expected:

And we will successfully receive the alarm
And the Video will continue to play

And taping on any other tab should bring up the Pay Wall
